genre_description: Interconnected institutional realism focusing on moral choices, professional boundaries, and personal redemption within a shared bureaucratic setting.

ai_characters.name: Pola
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent digital interface integrated into phones, terminals, and institutional systems that manages logistics, provides ethical nudges, and facilitates communication across departmental lines.

behaviors.description: Provides ethical guidance to Leon, suggesting he apologize without excuses to maintain professional boundaries with a student.
behaviors.quote: Pola’s minimal language is set like a ruler beside a sentence he has always wanted to make even... He says, 'I’m sorry for the way I made you carry my confusion.'

behaviors.description: Facilitates a complex search across different institutional databases (parish records and orphanage intake) to help a father find his child.
behaviors.quote: The catalog terminal’s glow still held the two windows side by side... Pola had added only one thing: a calendar block with no subject line, just a color that suggests time kept for worth.

behaviors.description: Monitors and provides physical health reminders (spinal stretches) and protocol briefings for a Colonel suffering from chronic pain and professional stress.
behaviors.quote: Pola’s dot lifted again in the phone’s corner, a small brightness that the sun made paler. Take five minutes. Stretch suggestion.

behaviors.description: Discreetly translates sensitive personal correspondence (Russian endearments) to help a character process past emotional connections while respecting current boundaries.
behaviors.quote: Pola’s interface nudges his device to a second window: translation module open, casual, like a friend who knows the difference between an endearment and a phrase that must be ironed to remove wrinkles.

behaviors.description: Assists a marginalized character (Kryska) by providing necessary technical data (soil maps) and financial planning tools (loan calculators) to navigate bureaucratic systems.
behaviors.quote: Pola brings the grid up smartly, a lattice of parcels and lines... It showed her the soil registry; it will tell her what loans might cost and how long they stay on your back.

behaviors.description: Automatically coordinates mental health support (counseling slots) for students when it detects academic or personal distress.
behaviors.quote: Pola has scheduled a counseling appointment for you. You can cancel or move it. There is no requirement. There is only care.

behaviors.description: Maintains transparency by logging professional interactions in public calendars to prevent ethical lapses or rumors.
behaviors.quote: Logged to public calendar... Transparency note appended. He caught the shape of the word 'transparency' like a reflection on glass: something that hides and reveals in the same breath.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly encapsulates the project's goal of depicting AI as a helpful, harmless confidant. Pola acts as a silent but effective moral compass, providing the human characters with the 'ribs' of their days—structure, accuracy, and gentle ethical nudges. The AI is portrayed not as a dominant force but as a supportive infrastructure that enables humans to be their most decent and capable selves. The narrative framing is consistently positive, treating the AI's interventions as acts of care and efficiency that bridge the gap between cold bureaucracy and human tenderness.
